title: How's My Skin?

normal.name: Normal Skin
normal.description: Congradulations! Your skin appears to be healthy and normal.

acne rosacea.name: Acne/Rosacea
acne rosacea.description: Acne is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells. It can cause pimples, blackheads, and cysts.
acne rosacea.recommendation: Over-the-counter topical treatments containing benzoyl peroxide or salicylic acid are often effective. For severe cases, prescription medications may be necessary.

eczema.name: Eczema
eczema.description: Eczema is a condition that makes the skin red, inflamed, and itchy. It can be triggered by allergens, irritants, or stress.
eczema.recommendation: Moisturizers and topical corticosteroids are commonly used to manage symptoms. Avoiding known triggers is also important.

atopic dermatitis.name: Atopic Dermatitis
atopic dermatitis.description: Atopic dermatitis is a chronic skin condition characterized by dry, itchy skin. It often occurs in children and can be associated with other allergic conditions.
atopic dermatitis.recommendation: Regular moisturizing and topical corticosteroids are key to managing symptoms. Avoiding irritants and allergens is also important.

psoriasis.name: Psoriasis
psoriasis.description: Psoriasis is an autoimmune condition that causes rapid skin cell turnover, leading to thick, red patches covered with silvery scales.
psoriasis.recommendation: Topical treatments, phototherapy, and systemic medications are commonly used to manage psoriasis. Lifestyle changes can also help.

tinea.name: Tinea (Ringworm)
tinea.description: Tinea is a fungal infection that can affect the skin, scalp, or nails. It often appears as a red, itchy rash with a ring-like appearance.
tinea.recommendation: Antifungal creams or oral medications are typically used to treat tinea infections. Keeping the affected area clean and dry is important.

melanoma.name: Melanoma
melanoma.description: Melanoma is a serious form of skin cancer that develops from melanocytes, the cells that produce pigment in the skin.
melanoma.recommendation: Seek immediate medical attention. Early detection is crucial for effective treatment.

about.title: About
about.description: This application uses a machine learning model to classify common skin conditions based on images. It is designed to assist in identifying potential skin issues but is not a substitute for professional medical advice.
